IRM 3.40.8, Block Out of Balance Resolution, Information Returns Processing dated November 14, 2020 (effective January 01, 2020) is superseded. IRM Procedural (IPU) 20U0690 issued June 11, 2020.
Employees in the Accounting Operation, Block Out of Balance (BOB) , Wage and Investment division.

Income Information Return Processing Format Codes and Required Fields for Returns Income Information Return Processing Return Money Fields Transcribed or Scanned Valid File Location Codes (FLC) by Service Center (SC)
) This program detects for correction inconsistencies in the structure of the tronic data record created by paper intake systems. (

) Purpose: This IRM provides instruction for correcting error register for income information returns processed on Integrated Submission and Processing (ISRP) and Service Center Recognition Imaging Processing System (SCRIPS). (
) Audience: Clerks in Submission Processing Accounting Operation at all campuses with oversight from their leads and supervisors. (
) Policy Owner: The Director of Submission Processing. (
) Program Owner: Submission Processing, Accounting and Tax Payment Branch, Accounting and Deposit Section (
) Primary Stakeholder: Small Business/Self Employed (SB/SE), Operations, Headquarters Examinations (

) Program Goals: The goal of this program is to correct all electronic income information return data records failing the validations needed to the GMF run stream under program information return paper processing documents (IRPPD). (

) Filers send paper income information returns to IRS to fulﬁll their ﬁling ment. IRS must convert these returns and source documents to electronic records. Paper ﬁled records failing the basic validation criteria to enter the eralized main frame (GMF) system as valid records fall to the Block Out of Balance (BOB) error registers instead of entering the processing run Employees must correct documents failing basic validity, consistency or structure criteria before they can enter the automated run stream during tronic conversion. (
) Authority for these procedures is found in title
of the United States (USC) or more commonly known as the Internal Revenue Code (IRC),
, and corresponding Treasury regulations. The IRC is amended by public laws, treasury determinations, rules, and regulations such as the following: • The Housing and Economic Recovery Act of
• American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of
• Tax Increase Prevention Act of
• Trade Preferences Extension Act of
• Surface Transportation and Veterans Health Care Choice Act of

3.40 Block Out of Balance Resolution
) The Director, SP, oversees the policies in this IRM and approves and rizes the issuance of this Internal Management Document. (
) The Operations Manager secures, assigns and provides training for the performing these tasks. (
) The team manager assigns cases to employees, controls the workﬂow, accurately records hours used and volume completed. (
) The employee (clerk) applies the instruction in this IRM when working the paper error register. (
) Program Reports: Consult IRM

, Block Out of Balance Resolution General Instructions, should be consulted for control of BOB error Management The following lists error register reports the Service Centers uses to and track the error inventory. • GMF
, IRP Block Out of Balance Register, generated daily if data records BOB • GMF
, IRP Block Out of Balance ID List, generated daily if exist • Miscellaneous Inventory Report (MIR), (formerly known as the Report) weekly report tracking aged cases for completion • DED
, Edit Block Proof List • DED
, DED

) Program Effectiveness: Management measures goals using standard documents processed per hour reports and by successful completion of required amount of error data records prior to the program completion stated in IRM
, Work Planning and Control Processing Cycles, Criteria, and Critical Dates. (
) Annual Review: Management reviews the processes included in this annually to ensure accuracy and promote consistent tax administration. (

) Generalized mainline framework (GMF) is ran electronically each workday creates the error register based on the presence of BOB error conditions Controls are present on the ﬁles entering income IRP mainline for the assigned (
) Unit production cards (UPCs) will be dropped as frequent as daily or at weekly to record activity in each functionality of this program. (
) Use local reports to establish more information for supporting daily control. Local reports do not replace the established official reports and required production reporting. (

) Most BOB conditions relate directly to the block header record which is Register General the beginning of each block from Form
, Block and Selection Record, Form
, Re-Entry Document Control. These conditions can be corrected adjustments to the block header record. (
) On occasion, individual return data need to be corrected instead of the header. (

) Account type codes “S” or “Y” may appear on a BOB register. If this call your Service Center (SC) Planning and Analysis analyst to relay it to Submission Processing, Accounting and Deposit Section analyst. (
) Information Return Program (IRP) BOB registers are to be separated by program number. Within each program the registers are to be sorted by of Balance number and alpha block control number, with r
OBs listed ﬁrst. Register Format (

) Individual return sections only displays when the BOB code condition their presence. a. The ﬁrst two lines of each register (page) has systemic identiﬁcation data. Included in these lines, the BOB sequence number and BOB codes. b. The third line have block header information. Alpha ﬁeld designators error asterisks appear above the third line. c. The fourth and succeeding lines have the individual document records and other identiﬁcation data (i.e., mixed problem code indicator). (

Returns Processing 3.40.8 page 11 Valid Account Type Code Deﬁnition “B” Form 1096, Annual Summary and Transmittal of U.S. Information Returns was prepared and submitted by the payer. “C” A “Dummy” Form 1096, Annual Summary and Transmittal of U.S. Information Returns prepared by IRS because the payer did not submit one. Currently Obsolete The block of returns is from a “J” Foreign Treaty Country and is ﬁled magnetically Currently Obsolete. Notify your manage- ment support analyst who notiﬁes National Office if this occurs. “M” This code is reserved. “P” The block of returns is from a domestic payer(s) and process- able in IRP. “S” The block of returns is input through SCRIPS. Currently Obsolete The block of returns is, ﬁled on “T” paper, from a Foreign Treaty Country and processable in IRP. Notify your management support analyst who notiﬁes National Office if this occurs. Currently Obsolete The block of returns is submitted “Y” electronically and should only appear for Schedules K-1. Notify your management support analyst who notiﬁes National Office if this occurs. “Z” This code is reserved.
The block of returns is submitted electronically and should only appear for Schedules K-

) BOB code “M” is used for errors identiﬁed by the ISRP operator. a. ISRP should attach a note indicating the input error. b. Overlay mixed data sections using Action Code “
”. c. Enter Action Code “
” for the block header section when the entire is correct. d. Contact ISRP to determine why the operator entered a mixed data message if a note is not attached. e. Correct with Action Code “

) BOB code “N” occurs when two or more blocks of original documents (i.e., the re-input source code is blank) is input on the same day with the same document locator number (DLN). The second and subsequent blocks P on the BOB register with BOB code “N”. For proper resolution: a. Work the blocks together for proper resolution. The blocks should be consecutive on the BOB register unless they are from different master ﬁles. b. Enter incorrectly transcribed block DLN on the register. Use Action “
” unless the transcription error has caused the format codes to be incorrect. c. Enter Action Code “N”, SCCF Adjustment Indicator “
”, if the must be re-input. d. Renumber all blocks except

if all document locator numbers DLN(s) transcribed correctly. Check the SCCF Summary at the bottom of the record. The count and amount may be correct for only one of the blocks. Select the other blocks to be renumbered if any block is valid on the SCCF and no other BOB conditions exist. e. Assign new DLN(s) to duplicate block(s). Refer to IRM
, Block of Balance Resolution, General Instructions. Establish the new DLN(s) on the SCCF using Adjustment Code “
”. Correct the new DLN(s) on the BOB register with Action Code “

) BOB code “Q” occurs when a block of original documents is processed for SCCF DLN that has a document count of zero. a. Examine the documents to determine the cause of the BOB condition. and b. Correct the re-input source code (ﬁeld B) if transcribed in error. c. The ﬁeld should be blank for documents blocked by Form
, Block and Selection Record and “
” for reprocessable returns input with

, Re-Entry Document Control. Note: Other BOB codes may suggest the proper corrective action if ﬁeld is correct. d. Check for transcription errors in other header ﬁelds, particularly the e. Request help from the data control function. Data Control may be working a related posting transcript. Otherwise, a special SCCF may resolve the problem. f. Renumber the documents or adjust the SCCF as indicated. (
) BOB code “R” occurs when the SCCF count, block header totals and proof totals are inconsistent. a. Follow correction procedures for BOB code “
” above. b. Compare the SCCF count with the block header and block proof c. Prepare necessary SCCF adjustments. Internal Revenue Manual

, Block Out of Balance Resolution, General Instructions. f. Ensure each SCCF adjustment is prepared only once. In some cases, adjustment is already prepared by the person working the CRL or SCCF posting transcripts. g. Release the block with Action Code “
” when SCCF action is h. Enter the proper DLN with Action Code “
”, if the DLN on the register is transcribed incorrectly. i. Renumber the documents if the DLN is invalid. Refer to IRM
, Block Out of Balance Resolution, General Instructions. j. Prepare a “
” SCCF adjustment. The block is normally re-input with Action Code “N”.
j. Prepare a “

” SCCF adjustment. The block is normally re-input with Action Code “N”. BOB code “Q” occurs when a block of original documents is processed for SCCF DLN that has a document count of zero. a. Examine the documents to determine the cause of the BOB condition. b. Correct the re-input source code (ﬁeld B) if transcribed in error. c. The ﬁeld should be blank for documents blocked by Form
, Block and Selection Record and “
” for reprocessable returns input with

, Re-Entry Document Control. Note: Other BOB codes may suggest the proper corrective action if ﬁeld is correct. d. Check for transcription errors in other header ﬁelds, particularly the e. Request help from the data control function. Data Control may be working a related posting transcript. Otherwise, a special SCCF may resolve the problem. f. Renumber the documents or adjust the SCCF as indicated. BOB code “R” occurs when the SCCF count, block header totals and proof totals are inconsistent. a. Follow correction procedures for BOB code “
” above. b. Compare the SCCF count with the block header and block proof c. Prepare necessary SCCF adjustments.
3.40.8.4.6 (01-01-2016) Block Out of Balance (BOB) Codes Q, R, and S
Block Out of Balance (

) BOB code “S” identiﬁes blocks for which more than one SCCF DLN key record or Master Control Record (MCR) is input for the same DLN. a. Normally, at least one of the duplicate control records is input on the same day and would produce a SCCF posting transcript which should worked at the same time by the data control function. b. Contact Data Control and jointly determine which control record is correct. Data Control prepares the necessary SCCF adjustments. c. Correct the BOB register when SCCF action is completed. Use Action Code “
” if no other BOB code(s) is present. (

) BOB code “T” identiﬁes a block for which the format code failed to match a master ﬁle system code or failed to match a valid DLN for the master ﬁle. a. A program problem in the validity table is indicated if this code appears X with no other BOB condition. b. Report the problem to your supervisor for referral to the National Office. c. Each condition should be resolved as the other conditions will be corrected if other BOB codes are present. If not, refer the problem to the National Office. (
) BOB code “X” appears on a r

OB item in which the previous correction is incorrectly edited or transcribed. a. Refer to the Invalid BOB Correction List which shows the complete input record and a literal indicating the reason for the invalid correction if more information is needed to determine the cause of the invalid correction. b. The literals: No Match on File; Invalid Correction attempt; Incompatible SER # or Account Number Invalid BOB Sequence Number; BOB Sequence Match but wrong type; No matching serial number; and Invalid Document add. (

) Action Codes will be used to correct records and/or blocks on the BOB Register. They should be coded to the left of the block header “BH” or section number of the document section on the register being corrected, or on Form
, Block Out of Balance (BOB) Correction Record, when it is being used (not on the register). (
) The valid IRP Action Codes: “

Normally, at least one of the duplicate control records is input on the same day and would produce a SCCF posting transcript which should worked at the same time by the data control function. Valid Action Code Description/Uses 1 a. Adds a document. When used, sections 01, 02, and 06 must be entered on Form 6813, Block Out of Balance (BOB) Correction Record. b. Section 16 is not required unless the payer data is different from the preceding document. If section 16 is entered, Action Code “1” must be entered on Form 6813. c. Section 16 must not be present for Form 1096, Annual Summary and Trans- mittal of U.S. Information Returns. d. When coding Form 1096 for re-input, there are “blind” ﬁelds. These “blind” ﬁelds must be entered. • Form 1096 Amount is coded as one ﬁeld on the BOB register. It is followed by a date in YYYYMMDD format. 2 Deletes a document.

page Valid Action Code Description/Uses 3 a. Overlays (substitutes) a section. b. Cannot be used for the Block Header Section. c. Must be used to correct a document section whenever the necessary alpha ﬁeld designators are not displayed. d. There is“ blind” ﬁelds when coding Form 1096 for re- input. These “blind” ﬁelds must be entered. • Form 1096 Amount is coded as one ﬁeld on the BOB register. does not require a date. 4 a. Deletes a section. b. Only used for section 16. 6 a. Changes ﬁelds within a section. b. Corrects any section (including the Block Header) which has alpha ﬁeld desig- nators. Note: Enter the SCCF Ad- justment Indicator “0”, “2” or “3” im- mediately after the action code when correcting the Block Header Section with Action Code “6”. 7 a. Retests and/or clears a block when it is correct without any changes, (dummy correction). b. Enter it to the left of the Block Header Section.

Valid Action Code Description/Uses D a. Deletes a block that is input in error. b. BOB SCCF Adjustment Indicator “1” or “0” must also be present with Action Code “D”. c. Only used when the block is transcribed twice and BOB Code “N” is present. • Form 1096, Annual Summary and Trans- mittal of U.S. Information Returns • Form 1099-R, Distri- butions From Pensions, Annuities, Retirement or Proﬁt Sharing Plans, IRAs, Insurance Contracts, etc. • Form W-2G, Certain Gambling Winnings N a. Deletes a block that should be re-input using a different DLN. b. BOB SCCF Adjustment Indicator “0” or “1” must be present when used. c. When used with BOB SCCF Adjustment Indicator “1”, the new DLN, Master File Tax Account (MFT) Code (or a circled “2” if MFT is blank) and Account Type Code must be entered on the register. Do not enter a comma for this correction. d. Automatically adjusts the SCCF by informing it of the new DLN. The SCCF then waits for the new DLN to appear. Refer to IRM 3.40.37.4.4, Control of BOB Registers, for more detail. R a. Deletes a block that must be re-input using the same DLN, MFT and Account Type Code.

Block Header Section/Field Description/Use Field A, Batch Number a. This ﬁeld must be numeric. Field B, Re-input Source Code a. This ﬁeld should be blank for blocks entered with Form 1332, Block and Selection Record. Enter a circled “1” by a comma, after ﬁeld des- ignator B to blank the ﬁeld. b. This ﬁeld should be “4”, for blocks entered with Form 3893, Re-Entry Document Control. Field C, Block DLN a. This ﬁeld should be the ﬁrst eleven digits of the Form 1332, Block and Selection Record, or Form 3893, Re- Entry Document Control, DLN. b. Correct an incorrectly tran- scribed Block DLN with Action Code “6” unless the format code is incorrect. c. Enter Action Code “R” if the format code is incorrect and route the documents for re- input. d. If the DLN is in error. Refer to IRM 3.40.37, Block Out of Balance Resolution, General Instructions. e. File location codes (FLC) and Julian dates are different depending on how they were input to General- ized Mainline Framework (GMF). Note: ISRP input documents can only have the one speciﬁc FLC and 001 through 366 Julian dates. See Exhibit 3.40.8-3, Valid File Location Codes (FLC) by Service Center (SC).

Block Header Section/Field Description/Use Field D, Year Digit a. This ﬁeld is the fourteenth digit of the DLN. It should always be generated as pro- cessing year most inputs except Schedule K-1 and prior year Form 1096, Annual Summary and Trans- mittal of U.S. Information Returns. b. This ﬁeld may be tran- scribed for Schedules K-1 and prior year Form 1096, Annual Summary and Trans- mittal of U.S. Information Returns.1.Iftranscribed, it must be processing year minus 1. 2. If not transcribed, it is generated as process- ing year. c. Use Action Code “6” to correct an erroneous year digit. Refer to IRM 3.40.37, Block Out of Balance Reso- lution, General Instructions, for further instructions.

Block Header Section/Field Description/Use Field E, Block Header MFT a. This ﬁeld should be blank, except for Form 1096, Annual Summary and Trans- mittal of U.S. Information Returns blocks. Enter a circled “2”; followed by a comma after ﬁeld designator E to blank the ﬁeld. b. This ﬁeld should be “69” for Form 1096, Annual Summary and Transmittal of U.S. Information Returns. c. Use Action Code “6” to correct an erroneous Block Header Master File Tax Code (MFT) if the generated block header format code is incorrect. d. Pull the block if a positive identiﬁcation cannot be de- termined. Refer to IRM 3.40.37, Block Out of Balance Resolution, General Instructions, to adjust the SCCF. e. Use Action Code “R” to re- input the document using the same DLN (if the DLN was correct), when the document is on the right IRP ﬁle but the wrong format code is generated. Adjust the SCCF if necessary. f. Use Action Code “N” and renumber the document if the ISRP Format Code is incorrect on other documents.

Block Header Section/Field Description/Use Field F, Block Tax Period a. The block tax period is tran- scribed from the ﬁrst return in the block when present. b. The block tax period for Schedules K-1 must be pro- cessing year or processing year minus one. c. The block tax period for Form 1096, Annual Summary and Transmittal of U.S. Information Returns, should be blank (indicating current year being processed) or processing year minus up to four. d. The block tax period for inputs of Information Return Processing entries should be blank. Edit a circled “2” to blank the ﬁeld. e. When the block tax period is blank, it is generated as pro- cessing year minus one after BOB processing for all return types except Schedules K-1. f. Use Action Code “6” to correct an erroneous Block Tax Period.

Block Header Section/Field Description/Use Field G, Block Account Type a. The Block ATC is tran- Code (ATC) scribed from the ﬁrst position coded in the Trans- action Code Box on Form 1332, Block and Selection Record or Form 3893, Re- Entry Document Control. b. The Block ATC must be “B”, “C”, “J”, “P”, “S”, “T”, or “Y” 1. The block must be Form 1096 if the ATC is “B” or “C”, 2. The block must be domestic IRP form if the ATC is “P”. 3. The block must be foreign Form 1099 (series) if the ATC is “J” or “T”. 4. The block must be Schedule K-1 if the ATC is “Y”. Contact your management support staff analyst for referral to National Office if you receive any of these. 5. Blocks assigned ATC “S” must be processed via SCRIPS listed under in program 44340 in IRM 3.40.8.4.3 (1). c. ATC Codes deﬁned in IRM 3.40.8.4.3 (2) (b), BOB Code “8”. d. Use Action Code “6” to correct an erroneous Block ATC.

Block Header Section/Field Description/Use Field H, Block Corrected/ a. Field H is transcribed from Amended Documents Indicator the second position coded in the Transaction Code Box on Form 1332, Block and Selection Record, or Form 3893, Re-Entry Document Control. b. All block headers to be processed as original, and must be coded “F”. c. Use Action Code “6” to correct an erroneous Block Corrected/AmendedDocumentsIndicator. Field I, Block Payer Count per a. Field I is transcribed from Header the third, fourth and ﬁfth positions coded in the Transaction Code Box on Form 1332, Block and Selection Record, or Form 3893, Re-Entry Document Control. b. Field I must be in the range from 001 to 100 (except Form 1096, Annual Summary and Transmittal of U.S. Information Returns). c. Field I must be 000 for Form 1096, Annual Summary and Transmittal of U.S. Informa- tion Returns. d. Field I is used to verify section 16 is transcribed correctly. See BOB Code “7” instructions, IRM 3.40.8.4.2, Block Out of Balance (BOB) Codes 6 and 7, for details.

Block Header Section/Field Description/Use Field L, Block Document Count a. Field L is transcribed as 100 per Header unless a number is circled on Form 1332, Block and Selection Record or Form 3893, Re-Entry Document Control or is input through Optical Character Recogni- tion (OCR). b. Field L is used to verify all returns in a block is tran- scribed. c. See BOB Code “9” instruc- tions, IRM 3.40.8.4.4, Block Out of Balance (BOB) Codes 9 and M, for details. Field M, Block Header Money Field M must be “.00” for all IRP Amount 1 blocks. Field N, Block Header Money Field N must be “.00” for all IRP Amount 2 blocks. Field O, Block Header Block Field O must be “.00” for all IRP Header blocks.
) The detailed document records, or parts of them, appears for some BOB codes. Error asterisks do not appear in the document sections. (
) When the detailed records appear, they begin immediately below the Header data. (
) The individual return serial number appears to the left of the ﬁrst section number printed (some BOB codes do not require all sections of a return printed). (

) Make corrections by lining through incorrect data and entering the above or to the left of the ﬁeld. If a ﬁeld is missing, and needs to be enter it to the right of the correct alpha designator. If no alpha designator present, edit one and enter the correction to the right of it. (

page BOB CORRECTION Description/Action Section 01 a. Has the following identiﬁca- tion data when present: • Payee TIN this ﬁeld does not have an alpha desig- nator • Delete Document IndicatorDorblank • Name line 1 • Name line 2 • Field A - Return Format Code This ﬁeld is only sig- niﬁcant for the ﬁrst return in the block. It should appear with all zeros for second and subsequent returns in the block. It is used to verify the block of returns was numbered and/or transcribed correctly. b. Correct this ﬁeld with Action Code “6”. 02 a. Displays the following identi- ﬁcation data ﬁelds for BOB code “M”. • Street Address • City • State • Zip Code • Payer Account Number • Amended Document Code • Check Digits • Name Control • TIN Type • Tax Year (K-1 only) b. Only the section literal “02” displays for all other BOB codes.

Returns Processing 3.40.8 page 29 BOB CORRECTION Description/Action Section 16 a. Section 16 has the following ﬁelds, if present: • Field A - Payer Name Line 1 • Field B - Payer Name Line 2 • Field C - Payer Street Address • Field D - Payer City • Field E - Payer State Code • Field F - Payer Zip Code • Field G - Payer TIN; TIN Validity Bypass Code • Field H - Payer Document Locator Number (DLN) • Field I - Foreign Country Code. This should only appear at Austin, TX only for Account Type Codes “J” or “T”. • Field H - Payer DLN, must be a 14-digit DLN, when its presence is required. If the DLN shown on the document is only 13-digits, add the current list year to make a 14-digit DLN.
